intro: Hieracium subulosifrons, commonly known as the bristly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine, bristly hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow and bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium subulosifrons is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to different environments.
